conclusion: The current light source is positioned such that the shadows A, B, C, and D are cast on the ground in front of the objects.
Shadow A corresponds to the glove, B to the ring, C to the corkboard, and D to the envelope.
When the light source moves to the back left, all shadows will move towards the front right.
Shadow A (Glove) will shift towards the front right, becoming longer and more skewed to the right.
Shadow B (Ring) will shift towards the front right, elongating the shadow in that direction.
Shadow C (Corkboard) will move towards the front right, with the skew becoming more pronounced.
Shadow D (Envelope) will move towards the front right, elongating and shifting direction.
When the light source moves to the back right, all shadows will move towards the front left.
Shadow A (Glove) will shift towards the front left, becoming longer and more skewed to the left.
Shadow B (Ring) will shift towards the front left, elongating the shadow in that direction.
Shadow C (Corkboard) will move towards the front left, with the skew becoming more pronounced.
Shadow D (Envelope) will move towards the front left, elongating and shifting direction.
As the light source moves closer to the objects (either back left or back right), the shadows will become larger.
As the light source moves further away, the shadows will become smaller.
Shadows will shift towards the front right when the light moves to the back left and towards the front left when the light moves to the back right.
Shadows will become larger as the light source moves closer and smaller as it moves further away.
When the light source moves to the back left, shadows A, B, C, and D will shift towards the front right and become larger.
When the light source moves to the back right, shadows A, B, C, and D will shift towards the front left and become larger.
The size of the shadows will increase as the light source moves closer to the objects and decrease as it moves further away.
